headline: Learn how an effective marketing strategy can make the most out of social media in this free online diploma course.

We study the rise of social media and explain how to conduct and audit market analysis to help you set goals and select content, channels and platforms. We investigate how to create a social media policy and integrate marketing strategies to improve your client’s brand profile. This diploma course teaches you how to use social media to get ahead.

courseDescription:
This course traces the rise of social media over the last two decades. We show you how to conduct market analysis to better understand your customer base. We then explain how to audit social networks to identify where to spend resources with maximum return. We use practical demonstrations to illustrate the use of social listening and grading tools.

The course then discusses how to set goals and select platforms that suit your social media content strategy. We examine the role of corporate culture in defining social media marketing plans as we place social media goals in the context of organizational objectives across various platforms. We lay out the process of crafting content that meets your client’s needs step by step.

The course demonstrates how to provide feedback using social media success platforms. We explain how marketing personas work and break down how to organize customer service with examples of target audience feedback. Finally, we show you how to launch successful social media campaigns while composing the relevant documentation and schedules. This diploma course teaches you how to leverage social media into professional success. With its massive audience reach and dynamic marketing capabilities, social media offers organizations the opportunity to reach more people than ever before so sign up to make the most of this exciting new way to communicate.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, The Rise of Social Media, students will learn about what social media is and how it has grown. Students will start by learning what social media is and what types of social media platforms exist, from blogs to image sharing, social networks, social book-marketing, video sharing, podcasts, and social news. By completing this module, students will have an understanding of where social media came from and what it is.
topics: Topic A - What is Social Media?
Topic B - The Growth of Social Media

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Conducting Market Analysis, students will learn to conduct market analysis. Students will begin by learning about the readiness assessment, which will allow them to gauge how ready the organization is to adopt social media. We will then look at segmentation, targeting, and positioning, or STP analysis. By completing this module, students will understand how to conduct a market analysis.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Auditing Social Media, students will learn about auditing social media, social listening tools, and get an example of grading tools. This module will discuss the importance of social media auditing to provide a snapshot of where your organization stands in its current social media capacity and performance. By completing this module, students will understand the process of auditing social media.
topics: Topic A - Demo 1 - Social Listening Tools
Topic A - Demo 2 - Example of Grading Tools

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Setting Goals and Selecting Platforms, students will learn about how corporate culture relates to social media, how the goals of social media can be used to further the goals of the business, and the various types of social media platforms that you will work with as a social media strategist. By completing this module, students will understand how to set goals and select platforms for social media campaigns.
topics: Topic A - Corporate Culture and Social Media
Topic B - Social Media Goals vs. Business Goals
Topic C - Types of Social Media Platforms

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Wide-Area Networks, students will learn about the social media policy, context for social media policy, and utilizing content. Students will also learn about the Creative Commons, a nonprofit organization that facilitates free and easy-to-use copyright licenses that provide the public with a way to share and use protected content. By completing this module, students will be able to understand what wide-area networks are and how to use them.
topics: Topic A - The Social Media Policy
Topic A - Demo - Context for Social Media Policy

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Integrating Marketing Strategies, students will learn about brand marketing, including, contests, promotions, Google keyword planner, keyword selection, and where to use keywords. Brands encompass the identity of a company and its products and services as well as reflecting the personality of the company. Students will learn how this personality ties in with social media marketing strategies.
topics: Topic A - Demo 2 - Contests and Promotions
Topic A - Demo 3 - Google Keyword Planner
Topic B - Demo 1 - Where to use Keywords

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Developing Effective Content, students will learn about content marketing on social media, branded vs general content, content development, and trending content. Knowing how to best leverage content on social media means you'll understand how to make the most of your content to reach your goals. By completing this module, students will understand how to develop effective content.
topics: Topic A - Content Marketing on Social Media
Topic A - Demo 1 - Branded vs. General Content

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Understanding the Popular Platforms, students will learn about understanding the popular platforms, WordPress blogs, using Facebook, YouTube, creating a YouTube channel, uploading a video, Google+, advertising on Google+, LinkedIn, the business side of LinkedIn, Twitter, and advertising on Twitter. By completing this module, students will understand the popular social media platforms that are used.
topics: Topic A - Understanding the Popular Platforms
Topic A - Demo 5 - Creating a Channel
Topic A - Demo 8 - Advertising in Google+
Topic A - Demo 10 - Business Side of LinkedIn
Topic A - Demo 12 - Advertising in Twitter

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Launching Successful Campaigns, students will learn about traditional website advertising, social media contests, online contests, social media documentation and schedules, editorial calendar tool, project management software, the performance dashboard tool, and the social media management tool. By completing this module, students will understand how to launch successful campaigns on social media.
topics: Topic B - Social Media Documentation and Schedules
Topic B - Demo 1 - Editorial Calendar Tool
Topic C - Demo 1 - Performance Dashboard Tool
Topic C - Demo 2 - Social Media Management Tool

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Managing the Community, students will learn about the community manager role, creating a response community, importance of voice consistency, three personality musts, social media to build community, and Pinterest. Building and managing a community successfully isn't easy, but if done right it can provide a brand with a loyal customer base.
topics: Topic A - The Community Manager Role
Topic A - Demo 1 - Creating a Response Community
Topic B - Importance of Voice Consistency
Topic B - Demo 1 - Three Personality Musts
Topic B - Demo 2 - Social Media to Build Community

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Providing Customer Service, students will learn about organizational customer service, examples of feedback, and marketing personas that are used to help companies better understand their target market. Students will also learn about social media triage and online versus personal interactions. By completing this module, students will understand the process of using social media to provide customer service.
topics: Topic A - Demo 1 - Examples of Feedback
Topic C - Online versus Personal Interactions

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, students will learn about checking and understanding social media analytics. This module also covers gathering and analyzing statistics related to social media to better understand your audience engagement, goal value, and Google analytics. By completing this module students will have a better understanding of the how and why of social media analytics.
topics: Topic A - Demo 1 - Gathering and Analyzing Statistics Related to Social Media

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, The Social Media Strategist Career, students will learn in more depth about what a career as a social media strategist entails. With social media on the rise, understanding how to navigate the new, digital frontier with purpose will provide students with an edge in this new job market. By completing this module, students will understand the social media strategist career path.
topics: Topic A - The Social Media Strategist Career
